Quotes: Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself…
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quotes: Life is not a having and a getting, but a being and a becoming…
Author: Matthew Arnold

Quotes: When you doubt your power, you give power to your doubt…
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quotes: If you have knowledge, let others light their candles in it…
Author: Margaret Fuller

Quotes: While we are reasoning concerning life, life is gone…
Author: David Hume

Quotes: Thoughts become perception, perception becomes reality. Alter your thoughts, alter your reality…
Author: William James

Quotes: When one door closes another door opens…
Author: Alexander Graham Bell

Quotes: A man who permits his honor to be taken, permits his life to be taken…
Author: Pietro Aretino

Quotes: For the strength of the Pack is the Wolf, and the strength of the Wolf is the Pack…
Author: Rudyard Kipling

Quotes: Blossom by blossom the spring begins…
Author: Algernon Charles Swinburne

Quotes: Attract them by the way you live…
Author: Saint Augustine

Quotes: There are two days in the year that we can not do anything, yesterday and tomorrow…
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes: I do not believe in taking the right decision, I take a decision and make it right…
Author: Muhammad Ali Jinnah

Quotes: Why is it that people with the most narrow of minds seem to have the widest of mouths?…
Author: Lewis Carroll

Quotes: What you want to ignite in others must first burn inside yourself…
Author: Charlotte Bronte

Quotes: The person who has stopped being thankful has fallen asleep in life…
Author: Robert Louis Stevenson

Quotes: Man's highest duty is to protect animals from cruelty…
Author: Emile Zola

Quotes: If you give someone more than they can do, they will do it. If you give them only what they can do, they will do nothing…
Author: Rudyard Kipling

Quotes: You must have your heart on fire and your brain on ice…
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quotes: A man who fears suffering is already suffering from what he fears…
Author: Michel de Montaigne

Quotes: Take time as it comes, the wind as it blows, woman as she is…
Author: Alfred de Musset

Quotes: Where there is no vision, there is no hope…
Author: George Washington

Quotes: Before you heal the body you must first heal the mind…
Author: Aristotle

Quotes: Everybody feels the evil, but no one has courage or energy enough to seek the cure…
Author: Alexis de Tocqueville

Quotes: Men do not desire to be rich, but to be richer than other men…
Author: John Stuart Mill

Quotes: The appetites will rule if the mind is vacant…
Author: Mary Wollstonecraft

Quotes: Live life when you have it. Life is a splendid gift. There is nothing small about it…
Author: Florence Nightingale

Quotes: The world will not be inherited by the strongest, it will be inherited by those most able to change…
Author: Charles Darwin

Quotes: If you can get nothing better out of the world, get a good dinner out of it, at least…
Author: Herman Melville

Quotes: What history teaches us is that neither nations nor governments ever learn anything from it…
Author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

Quotes: Vision is the art of seeing things invisible…
Author: Jonathan Swift

Quotes: Where there is no imagination, there is no horror…
Author: Arthur Conan Doyle

Quotes: Fear not for the future, weep not for the past…
Author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

Quotes: When a man realizes his littleness, his greatness can appear…
Author: H. G. Wells

Quotes: My destination is no longer a place, rather a new way of seeing…
Author: Marcel Proust

Quotes: All saints have past and all sinners have a future…
Author: Anton Chekhov

Quotes: Never be afraid to stand with the minority when the minority is right, for the minority which is right will one day be the majority…
Author: William Jennings Bryan

Quotes: There is only one happiness in this life, to love and be loved…
Author: George Sand

Quotes: It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation…
Author: Herman Melville

Quotes: You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore…
Author: William Faulkner

Quotes: A boundary is not that at which something stops, but that from which something begins…
Author: Martin Heidegger

Quotes: It is hard to fight desire;but to control it is the sign of a reasonable man…
Author: Democritus

Quotes: The greater the risk, the sweeter the fruit…
Author: Pierre Corneille

Quotes: Life is like a beautiful melody, only the lyrics are messed up…
Author: Hans Christian Andersen

Quotes: Dead yesterdays and unborn tomorrows, why fret about it, if today be sweet…
Author: Omar Khayyam

Quotes: When everything is easy one quickly gets stupid…
Author: Maxim Gorky

Quotes: To get closer to Truth and Right, we need a beautiful and soft heart…
Author: Shams Tabrizi

Quotes: What is important in life is life, and not the result of life…
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: Never give up. No one knows what's going to happen next…
Author: L. Frank Baum

Quotes: For all evils there are two remedies - time and silence…
Author: Alexandre Dumas

Quotes: Only the man who says no is free…
Author: Herman Melville

Quotes: There are no impossible obstacles;there are just stronger and weaker wills, that's all!…
Author: Jules Verne

Quotes: When the impossible has been eliminated, all that remains no matter how improbable is possible…
Author: Arthur Conan Doyle

Quotes: The world is beautiful, but has a disease called man…
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: Love is anterior to life, posterior to death, initial of creation, and the exponent of breath…
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quotes: When we love – we grow…
Author: Theophile Gautier

Quotes: A nation which does not remember what it was yesterday does not know where it is today…
Author: Robert E. Lee

Quotes: Don't try to add more years to your life. Better add more life to your years…
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: Mercy to the guilty is cruelty to the innocent…
Author: Adam Smith

Quotes: Who lies for you will lie against you…
Author: John Locke

Quotes: One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well…
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: Life can only be understood backwards;but it must be lived forwards…
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quotes: Study nature, not books…
Author: Louis Agassiz

Quotes: When work is a pleasure, life is a joy. When work is duty, life is slavery…
Author: Maxim Gorky

Quotes: There is no such thing as freedom of choice unless there is freedom to refuse…
Author: David Hume

Quotes: He who can reach a child's heart can reach the worlds heart…
Author: Rudyard Kipling

Quotes: Confidence is the present tense of hope…
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quotes: Quality is never an accident. It is always the result of intelligent effort…
Author: John Ruskin

Quotes: Nothing ever becomes real till experienced…
Author: John Keats

Quotes: Simplicity is the final achievement…
Author: Frederic Chopin

Quotes: Experience is the name so many people give to their mistakes…
Author: Francis Scott Fitzgerald

Quotes: Half of today is better than all of tomorrow…
Author: Jean de la Fontaine

Quotes: Success comes from keeping the ears open and the mouth closed…
Author: John D. Rockefeller

Quotes: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication…
Author: Leonardo da Vinci

Quotes: If you wish to avoid seeing a fool you must first break your mirror…
Author: Francois Rabelais

Quotes: Listen with ears of tolerance! See through the eyes of compassion! Speak with the language of love…
Author: Rumi

Quotes: Getting is more fun than having…
Author: James Cook

Quotes: When men are most sure and arrogant they are commonly most mistaken…
Author: David Hume

Quotes: You yourself are your own obstacle. Rise above yourself…
Author: Hafiz

Quotes: Don't neglect the future in times of plenty, for tomorrow you may need what you wasted today…
Author: Aesop

Quotes: It's amazing how lovely common things become, if one only knows how to look at them…
Author: Louisa May Alcott

Quotes: A lawful kiss is never worth as much as a stolen one…
Author: Guy de Maupassant

Quotes: It is better to be unhappy and know the worst, than to be happy in a fool's paradise…
Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

Quotes: The proper function of man is to live not to exist…
Author: Jack London

Quotes: Our true nationality is mankind…
Author: H. G. Wells

Quotes: A man is great not because he hasn't failed;a man is great because failure hasn't stopped him…
Author: Confucius

Quotes: A child is not a vase to be filled, but a fire to be lit…
Author: Francois Rabelais

Quotes: The more I see of the representatives of the people, the more I admire my dogs…
Author: Alphonse de Lamartine

Quotes: When you rise in the morning, give thanks for the light, for your life, for your strength…
Author: Tecumseh

Quotes: Never try to impress a woman, because if you do she'll expect you to keep up the standard for the rest of your life…
Author: W. C. Fields

Quotes: The most valuable of all capital is that invested in human beings…
Author: Alfred Marshall

Quotes: Where knowledge is a duty, ignorance is a crime…
Author: Thomas Paine

Quotes: Man is not above nature, but in nature…
Author: Ernst Haeckel

Quotes: When the sufferers learn to think, then the thinkers will learn to suffer…
Author: Karl Marx

Quotes: You can stay young as long as you learn…
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quotes: One man with a gun can control 100 without one…
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quotes: Those who have courage to love should have courage to suffer…
Author: Anthony Trollope

Quotes: A wise man hears one word and understands two…
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quotes: A really great person is the person who makes every person feel great…
Author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

Quotes: Our words are giants when they do us an injury, and dwarfs when they do us a service…
Author: Wilkie Collins
